problem.p: During the Mexico City earthquake of 1985 certain buildings collapsed, while others remained standing. What was the issue with the buildings that collapsed? How could these collapses have been avoided?

div.p: The 1985 Mexico City earthquake had a predominant frequency that matched the natural frequency of many of the buildings in the area in the 5-15 story range. Shorter and taller buildings were not as affected and remained standing. After this earthquake the codes changed and engineers started paying attention to the frequencies of both buildings and earthquakes.
